page.title: 01CLAYPOLE,STUBTON AND FENTON
page.content: Our area is comprised of parts of the parishes of Claypole, Stubton and Fenton and includes the three actual villages. A few fields lie within the parish of Dry Doddington. The parts of the parishes of Claypole occupy approximately 66% of the area, Stubton 25%, Fenton 7% and Dry Doddington 2%. The whole area is predominately agricultural and nearly all of this arable. Most of the land is of strong clay or stiff loam. The lower River Witham dominates the Western part of the block flowing from the south to the north. The adjacent land is low lying and, until extensive drainage work made ploughing possible, was wholly meadowland. Formally the London and North Eastern Railway (L.N.E.R.), British Rail's main North-South line runs diagonally across the area.
